tspan.tspan: of allocations. When a small allocation is made, the
list of allocations can be steped over to find the
first available spot. And when a large allocation is
made, a new block can be appended to the end of the
This also means that the metadata can be stored
with the allocated data. And pages can be freed when
it's detected there's no more allocations in a block.
A page on x86_64 is 4096 bytes, which can be split
of small allocations. Said another way, the page can
either be split between 63 (not counting the header)
small allocations of up to 64 bytes, or as large as is
needed, with a 64 byte header preceeding

This is ignored on split pages, and is
